frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe an Experiencer's emotions with respect to some Content.
An Agent prepares for an Activity. '' 'The troops were preparing themselves for the mission.'
A Protagonist performs some Action without fully considering the circumstances under which he or she acts, or the possibly (negative) consequences of the Action.
This frame has similarities to Experiencer_subject, but here the verbs are more 'active' in meaning.
A person, the Cognizer, thinks about a Topic over a period of time.
The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a Stimulus or about a Topic.
frameExamples: My <t>enjoyment</t> of the movie was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me.
The troops were <t>preparing</t> themselves for the mission.
Would it be a little <t>impatient</t> of me to ask when an album might appear?
Pat is still <t>worrying</t> about the exam.
The men were silently <t>mulling</t> <t>over</t> the proposition of committing an assassination
Mr. Whiskers is <t>upset</t> that there are no more cat treats.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.

<fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon.  The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
An <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> is preparing.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an <fen>Agent</fen> prepares for an <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> acts or is apt to act with some degree of consideration regarding the circumstances and possible consequences of an <fen>Action</fen> he or she may perform.
The <fen>Action</fen> is carried out by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> with or without regard for the circumstances under which it is performed or consideration of possible consequences.
The period of time when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> acts with (or without) consideration regarding an <fen>Action</fen>.
The role <fen>Experiencer</fen> indicates the one who is actively expressing emotion over the <fen>Topic</fen>.  It usually occurs as the subject of the verb.
The Experiencer's emotion generally is about something.  This is indicated with a <fen>Topic</fen> which usually occurs in a PP-Complement.
With a target verb, the Cognizer is usually expressed as an External Argument, with the Topic appearing as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal Complement, or a PP.
With a target verb, the <fen>Topic</fen> is usually expressed as an Object NP, a gerundive verbal complement, or a PP.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> considers the <fen>Topic</fen>.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
listRoleExamples: Mr. Whiskers was upset <fex>about his cat treats</fex>.
It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a nervous <fex>ceremony</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex>, Bob was still interested in the young Republicans.
I feel that most do, but typically <fex>people</fex> are rash, and often reach anger and hostility quickly.
<fex>What he did</fex> was impetuous and quite irrational - some might say ill-considered.
Were n't you impetuous <fex>when you were young</fex>?
Nan Ho turned, <fex>his</fex> extreme agitation unnoticed by the Prince.
Liz's anger <fex>towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.
'Can I help you?' she asked, trying not to let him see the amusement <fex>in her blue eyes</fex>.
The end of the film was filled with jubilant <fex>scenes</fex>.
